articles.author: Nellie Peyton, Nandita Bose
articles.description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa heads to the White House on Wednesday on a perilous mission to persuade a hostile Donald Trump to make deals with his country rather than scold and punish it as he has done since the start of his second term.
articles.title: South Africa's Ramaphosa faces Trump with deals on offer and golfers in tow

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Palestinians in Gaza were left waiting for the promised arrival of food on Wednesday despite mounting international and domestic pressure on the Israeli government to allow more aid to reach a population on the brink of famine after an 11-week blockade.
articles.title: Gaza still waiting for aid as pressure mounts on Israel

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Two Israeli embassy staff were shot at close range while attending a Jewish event at the Capital Jewish Museum in Washington DC, Axios reporter Barak Ravid said on X, citing an Israeli embassy spokesperson.
articles.title: Two Israeli embassy staff shot in Washington D.C., Axios reporter cites Israeli embassy

articles.author: Jonathan Landay
articles.description: The State Department office that handles refugee issues and works to cut illegal migration will lead the U.S. response to overseas disasters, according to excerpts from an internal department cable, a role for which experts say it lacks the knowhow and personnel.
articles.title: Exclusive: State Department refugee office to assume USAID's disaster aid role, says cable

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Dozens of people were injured during a protest outside Argentina's Congress on Wednesday where activists and retired Argentines demanded higher pensions, according to Reuters witnesses.
articles.title: Dozens injured in pension protest outside Argentina Congress

articles.author: Matt Spetalnick, David Brunnstrom, Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump turned down the lights in the Oval Office on Wednesday and made South African President Cyril Ramaphosa the target of his latest geopolitical ambush of a foreign leader in front of television cameras.
articles.title: Second Oval Office ambush by Trump could make foreign leaders think twice

articles.author: Jack Kim, Josh Smith
articles.description: A serious accident occurred on Wednesday during the launch of a new North Korean warship while Kim Jong Un was attending the event, with the isolated state's leader calling it a "criminal act" that could not be tolerated, state media KCNA reported.
articles.title: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un condemns warship accident as 'criminal'

articles.author: Renju Jose
articles.description: Torrential rain pummelled Australia's southeast on Thursday, triggering flash flooding and forcing officials to issue fresh evacuation orders, while 50,000 residents were warned to prepare to isolate with more downpours expected over the next 24 hours.
articles.title: Torrential rain ravages Australian towns, thousands brace for isolation

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Emergency services were on high alert in Crete on Thursday after a 6.1 magnitude quake hit off the Greek island, causing tremors felt across Turkey and Israel.
articles.title: Greek fire brigade on high alert after 6.1 magnitude quake strikes off Crete

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Singapore warned foreign embassies against inciting domestic reactions to international issues after the U.S and Chinese embassies in the city-state took swipes at each other on Facebook over the South China Sea dispute.
articles.title: Singapore tells embassies to avoid inciting domestic reactions to international issues
